input: Molim vas ispričajte priču o pandama.
method1_output:
Postoje samo dva poznata vrste pande: velika panda i crna panda. Velika panda je endemska vrsta koja se nalazi samo u Kini, dok crna panda živi u himalajskim šumama u Kini, Nepalu i Indiji.

Velike pande su dobro poznate po svojoj crno-bijeloj boji i prepoznatljivim crtama oko očiju. Često se nazivaju i "medvjedima od bambusa", jer većinu svog života provode jedući bambus, čak do 40 kilograma dnevno. Žive na planinskim padinama u Kini, na visinama do 3500 metara.

Crne pande su manje i manje poznate od velikih pandi. Imaju tamnu, crnu boju tijela, a njihova dlaka ima smeđi odsjaj. Također se hrane bambusom, ali dodatno jedu i bobice, voće, insekte i male sisavce. Žive u himalajskim šumama, a njihov broj je ugrožen zbog uništavanja njihovog staništa i krivolova.

Obe vrste pandi su ugrožene, s manje od 2000 jedinki velike pande preostalih u prirodi, i manje od 10.000 crnih pandi. Njihova preživljavanje ovisi o daljnjim naporima zaštite prirode i očuvanja njihovog staništa.
****************English Meaning****************
There are only two known species of pandas: the giant panda and the red panda. Giant pandas are an endemic species found only in China, while red pandas live in the Himalayan forests of China, Nepal, and India.

Giant pandas are well known for their black and white fur and distinctive eye patches. They are often called "bamboo bears" because they spend most of their lives eating bamboo, up to 40 kilograms per day. They live on mountain slopes in China, at elevations up to 3500 meters.

Red pandas are smaller and less well known than giant pandas. They have a dark, black body color, with reddish-brown highlights in their fur. They also eat bamboo, but also consume berries, fruit, insects, and small mammals. They live in the Himalayan forests, and their population is threatened by habitat destruction and poaching.

Both species of pandas are endangered, with less than 2000 giant pandas remaining in the wild, and less than 10,000 red pandas. Their survival depends on further efforts to protect nature and preserve their habitats.
method2_step1_output: Please tell us the story about pandas.
method2_step2_output:
The giant panda is a beloved species that has captured the hearts of people all over the world. These unique creatures are native to the mountains of central China, with most of them living in the Sichuan, Shaanxi, and Gansu provinces.

The earliest known mention of pandas was in Chinese literature from over 2000 years ago. At that time, pandas were regarded as a symbol of peace and harmony. They were often kept by Chinese emperors as a sign of their power and prestige.

While pandas have always been highly respected in Chinese culture, it wasn't until the 20th century that they caught the attention of the rest of the world. In the 1930s, a French zoologist named Armand David brought the first live panda specimens to Europe. The world was captivated by these strange, cuddly creatures, and zoos around the world began clamouring to obtain their own pandas.

Sadly, the popularity of pandas has also led to their decline. Habitat loss, poaching, and other human activities have caused their numbers to drop to dangerously low levels. In the 1970s, the Chinese government began taking steps to protect the species, including creating protected habitat areas and instituting harsh penalties for panda poaching.

Today, there are around 1,800 pandas living in the wild, and an additional 300 pandas living in zoos around the world. The Chinese government continues to implement initiatives to protect the species, but much work still needs to be done to ensure the survival of these beloved creatures for generations to come.
method2_final_output:
Divovska pandu je obožavana vrsta koja je osvojila srca ljudi diljem svijeta. Ove jedinstvene životinje su domaće planinama središnje Kine, a većina živi u provincijama Sichuan, Shaanxi i Gansu.

Najranije poznato spominjanje pandi bilo je u kineskoj književnosti prije više od 2000 godina. Tada su pande bile simbol mira i harmonije. Često su bile držane od strane kineskih careva kao znak njihove moći i prestiža.

Dok su pande uvijek bile izuzetno poštovane u kineskoj kulturi, tek u 20. stoljeću privukle su pažnju ostatka svijeta. U 30-ima francuski zoolog Armand David doveo je prve žive primjerke pandi u Europu. Svijet je bio zapanjen ovim čudnim, umiljatim stvorenjima, a zoološki vrtovi diljem svijeta počeli su priželjkivati ​​svoje pande.

Nažalost, popularnost pandi također je dovela do njihovog smanjenja. Gubitak staništa, lovokrađa i druge ljudske aktivnosti doveli su do opasnog pada njihovog broja. U 70-ima, kineska vlada počela je poduzimati mjere za zaštitu vrste, uključujući stvaranje zaštićenih područja staništa i uvođenje stroge kazne za krivolov pandi.

Danas u divljini živi oko 1.800 pandi, a dodatnih 300 pandi živi u zoološkim vrtovima diljem svijeta. Kineska vlada nastavlja provoditi inicijative za zaštitu vrste, ali još mnogo posla treba učiniti kako bi se osigurala preživljavanje ovih dragih stvorenja za generacije koje dolaze.

input: Molim Vas, pružite mi shemu interijera uređenja u nordijskom stilu.
method1_output:
Na žalost, kao AI jezikovni model, nisam u mogućnosti generirati slike i sheme interijera. Međutim, mogu vam dati neke savjete o uređenju interijera u klasičnom nordijskom stilu koji će vam pomoći u dizajniranju vlastitog interijera.

1. Boje

Nordijski stil temelji se na bijeloj, svijetloj sivoj i bež boji. Ove boje daju sobi osjećaj prozračnosti i čistoće. Osim toga, možete dodati dašak boje kroz jastuke, zavjese ili tepih.

2. Materijali

Pojednostavljenost je ključ nordijskog stila. Drvo, koža i beton su neki od ključnih materijala ovog stila. Drvo se može koristiti za podove, namještaj i obloge. Beton se obično koristi za ploče i pločice za zidove. Koža se koristi za kauče i naslonjače u sobi.

3. Namještaj

Nordijski stil naglašava udobnost, funkcionalnost i jednostavnost. Minimalistički dizajn je u središtu pažnje, a namještaj bi trebao biti izrađen od prirodnih materijala koji su i trajni i elegantni.

4. Dodaci

Manje je više u nordijskom stilu, stoga nemojte pretjerivati s dodacima. Uvijek možete dodati svijeće u raznim veličinama i držačima u sobi te suptilne biljke kako biste stvorili toplinu i neizvjesnost.

5. Prirodna svjetlost

Svjetlo je važno za nordijski stil. Budući da je stil izvorno iz Finske, gdje su zime duge i tamne, prirodno svjetlo je ključno za očuvanje svijetlog i prozračnog prostora. Otvaranje zavjesa i prozora tijekom dana je najbolji način da se dobije prirodna rasvjeta.
****************English Meaning****************
Unfortunately, as an AI language model, I am unable to generate images and interior design schemes. However, I can give you some tips on decorating your interior in a classic Nordic style that will help you with your own design.

1. Colors

The Nordic style is based on white, light gray, and beige colors. These colors give the room a feeling of airiness and cleanliness. Additionally, you can add a touch of color through pillows, curtains, or a rug.

2. Materials

Simplicity is key in the Nordic style. Wood, leather, and concrete are some of the key materials in this style. Wood can be used for floors, furniture, and paneling. Concrete is usually used for wall slabs and tiles. Leather is used for sofas and armchairs in the room.

3. Furniture

The Nordic style emphasizes comfort, functionality, and simplicity. Minimalistic design is at the forefront, and furniture should be made of natural materials that are both durable and elegant.

4. Accessories

Less is more in the Nordic style, so don't overdo it with accessories. You can always add candles in various sizes and holders in the room and subtle plants to create warmth and uncertainty.

5. Natural Light

Light is important for the Nordic style. Since the style is originally from Finland, where winters are long and dark, natural light is crucial for maintaining a bright and airy space. Opening curtains and windows during the day is the best way to get natural lighting.
method2_step1_output: Please provide me with a scheme for interior decoration in the Nordic style.
method2_step2_output:
Here is a scheme for interior decoration in Nordic style:

1. Color Palette: The Nordic style is known for its neutral color palette. Use shades of white, beige, gray, and black as the base colors. Add pops of color sparingly with accents of muted blues, greens, and oranges.

2. Lighting: Natural light is a crucial element of Nordic style. Let in as much sunlight as possible, and use light, sheer curtains to filter the light. Supplement with soft, warm lighting throughout the room with lamps and candles.

3. Furniture: Choose furniture pieces that are functional, simple, and elegant. A minimalist approach is key. Natural materials such as wood and leather are popular choices for furniture in Nordic style.

4. Textiles: Textiles play an important role in Nordic decor. Incorporate cozy textures such as wool, linen, and sheepskin in throws, rugs, and pillows. Use rugs to define spaces and add texture to a room.

5. Decorative Accents: Nordic decor is all about simplicity, so keep decorative accents to a minimum. Use natural elements such as plants, wood pieces, and stone accents. Display a few statement art pieces, but keep the walls mostly bare.

6. Storage: Storage solutions in Nordic style are functional and stylish. Use built-in cabinets, floating shelves, and minimalistic storage pieces in the same color palette as the room to keep the space clutter-free.

By following these guidelines, you'll be able to achieve a beautiful and functional Nordic style interior decoration scheme.
method2_final_output:
Ovdje je shema za uređenje interijera u nordijskom stilu:

1. Paleta boja: Nordijski stil poznat je po svojoj neutralnoj paleti boja. Koristite nijanse bijele, bež, sive i crne kao osnovne boje. Dodajte akcente boja poput prigušenih plavih, zelenih i narančastih boja.

2. Rasvjeta: Prirodna svjetlost ključan je element nordijskog stila. Dopustite što više sunčeve svjetlosti i koristite svjetle, prozirne zavjese za filtriranje svjetlosti. Nadopunite mekom, toplom rasvjetom u sobi s lampama i svijećama.

3. Namještaj: Odaberite namještaj koji je funkcionalan, jednostavan i elegantan. Minimalistički pristup je ključan. Prirodni materijali poput drveta i kože popularni su izbori za namještaj u nordijskom stilu.

4. Tekstil: Tekstil igra važnu ulogu u nordijskom uređenju. Uključite ugodne teksture poput vune, lana i ovčje kože u pokrivače, tepihe i jastuke. Upotrijebite tepihe za definiranje prostora i dodajte teksturu u sobu.

5. Ukrasni akcenti: Nordijski ukras je sve o jednostavnosti, stoga ukrasne akcente držite na minimumu. Koristite prirodne elemente poput biljaka, drvenih komada i kamenih akcenta. Prikazujte nekoliko izjavljujućih umjetničkih djela, ali držite zidove uglavnom goli.

6. Pohrana: Rješenja za pohranu u nordijskom stilu funkcionalna su i stilski. Upotrijebite ugrađene ormariće, plutajuće police i minimalističke pohranjene komade u istoj paleti boja kao soba kako biste prostor održali bez nereda.

Slijedeći ove smjernice, moći ćete postići prekrasan i funkcionalan nordijski stil interijera.

input: Molim implementirajte algoritam strojnog učenja potpornih vektora (Support Vector Machine) koristeći Python.
method1_output:
Napomena: ovaj algoritam može biti prilično složen i nije preporučljivo da ga netko tko nema dobro poznavanje strojnog učenja i Pythona pokušava samostalno izraditi ili upotrebljavati bez detaljnijeg proučavanja.

U nastavku slijedi osnovni primjer implementacije algoritma potpornih vektora (Support Vector Machine) koristeći Python i knjižnice NumPy i scikit-learn.

Prvo, instalirajte potrebne knjižnice pomoću sljedeće naredbe u naredbenom retku:

```
pip install numpy scikit-learn
```

Zatim, u novom Python datoteci, uvezi potrebne knjižnice:

```python
import numpy as np
from sklearn import svm, datasets
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
```

Zatim učitajte skup podataka koji se koristi za treniranje:

```python
iris = datasets.load_iris()
X = iris.data[:, :2]
y = iris.target
```

U ovom primjeru koristimo samo prva dva svojstva od ukupno četiri značajke koje se nalaze u skupu podataka Iris. Također, uzimamo samo dvije klase od ukupno tri.

Podijelite skup podataka na skup za treniranje i skup za testiranje korištenjem scikit-learn funkcije train_test_split():

```python
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=0)
```

Definirajte i trenirajte SVM-model:

```python
model = svm.SVC(kernel='linear')
model.fit(X_train, y_train)
```

Testirajte model na skupu za testiranje i ispišite točnost:

```python
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
acc = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
print("Točnost:", acc)
```

Cijeli kod za implementaciju algoritma potpornih vektora koristeći Python i scikit-learn knjižnicu može se vidjeti u nastavku:

```python
import numpy as np
from sklearn import svm, datasets
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# učitaj skup podataka
iris = datasets.load_iris()
X = iris.data[:, :2]
y = iris.target

# podijeli skup podataka na skup za treniranje i skup za testiranje
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=0)

# definiraj i treniraj SVM-model
model = svm.SVC(kernel='linear')
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# testiraj model i ispiši točnost
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
acc = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
print("Točnost:", acc)
```

Ovaj primjer koristi linearan kernel za SVM-model, no metoda podržava i druge kernel funkcije koje se mogu koristiti u ovom algoritmu.
****************English Meaning****************
Note: This algorithm can be quite complex and it is not recommended for someone who does not have a good understanding of machine learning and Python to attempt to create or use it without more detailed study.

Below is a basic example implementation of the Support Vector Machine (SVM) algorithm using Python and the NumPy and scikit-learn libraries.

First, install the required libraries using the following command in the command line:

```
pip install numpy scikit-learn
```

Then, in a new Python file, import the necessary libraries:

```python
import numpy as np
from sklearn import svm, datasets
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
```

Then load the dataset used for training:

```python
iris = datasets.load_iris()
X = iris.data[:, :2]
y = iris.target
```

In this example, we are using only the first two features out of the total four features in the Iris dataset. We are also taking only two classes out of the total three.

Split the dataset into training and testing sets using the scikit-learn train_test_split() function:

```python
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=0)
```

Define and train the SVM model:

```python
model = svm.SVC(kernel='linear')
model.fit(X_train, y_train)
```

Test the model on the testing set and print the accuracy:

```python
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
acc = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
print("Accuracy:", acc)
```

The entire code for implementing the SVM algorithm using Python and the scikit-learn library can be seen below:

```python
import numpy as np
from sklearn import svm, datasets
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load the dataset
iris = datasets.load_iris()
X = iris.data[:, :2]
y = iris.target

# Split the dataset into training and testing sets
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=0)

# Define and train the SVM model
model = svm.SVC(kernel='linear')
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Test the model and print the accuracy
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
acc = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
print("Accuracy:", acc)
```

This example uses a linear kernel for the SVM model, but the method supports other kernel functions that can be used in this algorithm.
method2_step1_output: Please implement the Support Vector Machine machine learning algorithm using Python.
method2_step2_output:
Here is a basic implementation of the Support Vector Machine algorithm in Python using scikit-learn:

```python
from sklearn import datasets
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load iris dataset from scikit-learn
iris = datasets.load_iris()
X = iris.data
y = iris.target

# Split data into training and testing sets
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=1, stratify=y)

# Standardize data
sc = StandardScaler()
sc.fit(X_train)
X_train_std = sc.transform(X_train)
X_test_std = sc.transform(X_test)

# Initialize SVM classifier
svm = SVC(kernel='linear', C=1, random_state=1)

# Train SVM classifier
svm.fit(X_train_std, y_train)

# Predict test set labels
y_pred = svm.predict(X_test_std)

# Calculate test set accuracy
accuracy = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
print('Accuracy:', accuracy)
```

This code loads the iris dataset, splits the data into training and testing sets, standardizes the data, initializes an SVM classifier with a linear kernel and a regularization parameter of 1, trains the classifier on the training set, predicts the labels of the test set, and calculates the test set accuracy using scikit-learn's `accuracy_score` function.

Note that this is a basic implementation and there are many other options for SVM classifiers, such as different kernels and hyperparameters. Additionally, the code can be adapted to other datasets and problems.
method2_final_output:
Evo osnovne primjene algoritma Support Vector Machine u Python-u s korištenjem scikit-learn biblioteke:

```python
from sklearn import datasets
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Učitaj iris dataset iz scikit-learna
iris = datasets.load_iris()
X = iris.data
y = iris.target

# Podijeli podatke na skupove za učenje i testiranje
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=1, stratify=y)

# Standardiziraj podatke
sc = StandardScaler()
sc.fit(X_train)
X_train_std = sc.transform(X_train)
X_test_std = sc.transform(X_test)

# Inicijaliziraj SVM klasifikator
svm = SVC(kernel='linear', C=1, random_state=1)

# Treniraj SVM klasifikator
svm.fit(X_train_std, y_train)

# Predvidi labele testnog skupa
y_pred = svm.predict(X_test_std)

# Izračunaj točnost testnog skupa
accuracy = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
print('Točnost:', accuracy)
```

Ovaj kod učitava iris dataset, dijeli podatke na skupove za učenje i testiranje, standardizira podatke, inicijalizira SVM klasifikator s linearnim kernelom i parametrom regularizacije od 1, trenira klasifikator na skupu za učenje, predviđa labele testnog skupa i izračunava točnost testnog skupa koristeći scikit-learnovu funkciju `accuracy_score`.

Napomena da se radi o osnovnoj primjeni i da postoji mnogo drugih opcija za SVM klasifikatore, kao što su drugačiji kerneli i hiperparametri. Također, ovaj kod se može prilagoditi drugim skupovima podataka i problemima.

input: Molimo generirajte naslov na temelju sljedećeg sadržaja: CBA kažnjava dvije momčadi i trenere zbog "negativne igre" u doigravanju 17. travnja, Kineska košarkaška asocijacija održala je medijski breifing na kojem su objavljene kazne za košarkaške momčadi Shanghai Jushilong Lions i Suzhou Kenitex. Momčadi su kažnjene zbog "negativne igre" tijekom dvije kritične utakmice u doigravanju CBA. Kao rezultat, CBA je otkazala plasman i sudjelovanje dviju momčadi za sezonu i smanjila njihovo financiranje lige za 5 milijuna juana. Također su kažnjeni i treneri spomenutih momčadi, Li Chunjiang i Li Nan, glavni treneri Shanghai Jushilong i Suzhou Kenitexa, koji su izgubili certifikate za trenerski rad na pet i tri godine. Shilinjie, generalni menadžer Kenitex-a i Jiang Yusheng, generalni menadžer Jushilong-a, također su se suočili s petogodišnjim i trogodišnjim suspenzijama. Prema rasporedu, drugo kolo ovogodišnjeg CBA doigravanja trebalo je započeti te večeri utakmicom između Shenzhen Marco Polo i Shanghai Jushilong. Međutim, zbog zabrane, Shenzhen Marco Polo dobio je automatsku odobrenje za polufinale. Zhang Xiong, glavni direktor CBA, objasnio je da su kazne u skladu s disciplinskim propisima lige i ovise o mjeri i prepoznavanju kršenja. Yao Ming, predsjednik CBA, također je izrazio žaljenje zbog kazni, naglašavajući važnost integriteta u sportu iznad vještina. Nadao se da će liga kroz ovaj događaj postati bolja i stvoriti vrijednije ishode.
method1_output:
CBA kazni momčadi i trenere za "negativnu igru" u doigravanju: Shanghai Jushilong i Suzhou Kenitex izbačeni, treneri suspendirani, financiranje smanjeno za 5 milijuna juana.
****************English Meaning****************
CBA penalizes teams and coaches for "negative play" in playoffs: Shanghai Jushilong and Suzhou Kenitex expelled, coaches suspended, funding reduced by 5 million yuan.
method2_step1_output: Please generate a title based on the following content: CBA punishes two basketball teams and coaches for "negative play" during playoffs on April 17th. The Chinese Basketball Association held a media briefing where penalties were announced for the Shanghai Jushilong Lions and Suzhou Kenitex basketball teams. The teams were punished for "negative play" during two critical playoff games in the CBA. As a result, the CBA cancelled the placement and participation of both teams for the season and reduced their league funding by 5 million yuan. The coaches of both teams, Li Chunjiang and Li Nan, the head coaches of Shanghai Jushilong and Suzhou Kenitex, were also penalized by losing their coaching certificates for five and three years respectively. Shilinjie, the general manager of Kenitex, and Jiang Yusheng, the general manager of Jushilong, also faced five-year and three-year suspensions. According to the schedule, the second round of this year's CBA playoffs was supposed to begin that evening with a game between Shenzhen Marco Polo and Shanghai Jushilong. However, due to the ban, Shenzhen Marco Polo was automatically approved for the semi-finals. Zhang Xiong, the chief director of the CBA, explained that the penalties were in accordance with the league's disciplinary regulations and depend on the measure and recognition of the violation. Yao Ming, the president of the CBA, also expressed regret over the penalties, emphasizing the importance of integrity in sports over skills. He hoped that the league would become better and create more valuable outcomes through this event.
method2_step2_output: "CBA Punishes Two Basketball Teams and Coaches for "Negative Play" During Playoffs on April 17th"
method2_final_output: CBA kažnjava dvije košarkaške momčadi i trenere zbog "negativne igre" tijekom doigravanja 17. travnja.
